utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They are not.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: They are, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Your hypothesis is completely disconfirmed by all the data. You’re just clinging to it out of intellectual stubbornness.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, you’re displaying a shocking ignorance of the subject matter. Mummies and zombies are the exact same thing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? Mummies are wrapped in bandages.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: That’s called a fashion choice.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, you brought this on yourself. Sheldon, get him.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If a zombie bites you, you turn into a zombie. However, if a mummy bites you, all you turn into is some schmo with a mummy bite. So, like a zombie, that’s been eaten from the waist down, you, sir, have no leg to stand on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good boy. Here’s a cookie.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, thank you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, fellas, what’s going on?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, mummies and zombies again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, they’re not the same thing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You get a cookie, too.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks. Guess who picked up his new car this morning?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Congratulations. Does it have that new car smell?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yep. For as long as I can keep my mother out of it. If you want to check it out later, it’s parked right out front, space 294.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, 294?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s my parking spot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why do you have a parking spot? You don’t have a car. You don’t even drive.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. That’s my spot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe they reassigned it because you never use it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m not using my nipples, either. Maybe they should reassign those.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, someday, if you get a car, I’m sure they’ll give you another parking space.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I don’t want another parking space. I want my parking space. It’s perfect. It’s a corner spot, cutting the risk of door-dings in half. It’s a mere 28 steps from the building entrance. The nearby tree provides shade on hot days and is also home to a delightful squirrel. Which is fortuitous because most squirrels are real jerks.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fun story. Meanwhile, you still don’t have a car.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t try to change the subject. This is about a parking space. It has nothing to do with cars.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you listening to yourself?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I always listen to myself. It’s one of the great joys of my life. Now, get your car out of my spot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Very well. You leave me no choice.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you looking at, you stupid squirrel?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon (on phone)
utterance.content: President Siebert, listen to reason. Yeah, I understand I don’t use the parking spot, but that’s not the point. I… Yes, I’m aware you told me not to call you at home, but you didn’t answer the door. And I know you were there, because I saw you through the mail slot. Yeah, well, that’s some salty language. May I remind you that you’re the president of a major university, not the president of the Potty Mouth Club. There it is again. Do you kiss your mother with that mouth? Oh, well, I’m sorry for your loss. Good night, sir. Unbelievable. He says Wolowitz deserves my spot because he’s a high-profile asset to the university.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, he’s not wrong. Howard did go to the International Space Station.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, that was five weeks ago. How much longer is he gonna milk that cow?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, let it go. It’s not a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no, this is a slippery slope, Leonard. It starts with a parking space, where does it end? It’s like my dad always said, first they say you can’t drink and drive, next thing you know, you can’t let your 10-year-old take the wheel while you sleep one off in the backseat.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All that story does is make me feel bad for your mother.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Leonard, you’re my best friend. Why don’t you ever take my side?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because I can never understand your side.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Give it back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sorry, but could you be more specific?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My Iron Man helmet. Koothrappali saw you take it. Give it back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that. Well, see, I wanted it, and you weren’t using it. Apparently, those are the rules we live by now. Payback, it truly is the B word, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sheldon, that is a five hundred dollar limited edition collectible, and I want it back.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’d love to help you out, but unfortunately , I’m using it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Fine. I’m taking your diploma.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Go ahead. That’s the only doctorate you’ll ever get. It smells funny in here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: We’re so proud of you, Amy. Your first bikini wax.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. So, how you doing?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: A little sensitive, but not bad. Does it always take that long?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, no, they usually don’t have to go out and get more wax.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I feel like I’m five pounds lighter.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really? Only five?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, anybody want a drink?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay. So, did you spend last night hearing about this silly parking space fight, too?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: For hours. Fortunately, I couldn’t understand most of it ’cause Sheldon was wearing that stupid robot mask.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard was so angry I had to mash up Benadryl in his ice cream to get him to fall asleep.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess this is what we get for being with two testosterone-fueled alpha males. At some point, they’re bound to lock horns.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m assuming these are some kind of horns they bought at Comic-Con?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m really sorry they took Sheldon’s spot away. He shouldn’t have to suffer just because Howard’s such a big deal now.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I know, Sheldon should just let Howard have his little moment in the sun.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What’s that supposed to mean?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, I mean, Howard’s never gonna go to space again, but Sheldon will always be a genius.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re right. And I’m sure Sheldon will get a fancy parking spot again, if and when he makes a worthwhile contribution to science.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: If and when?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, maybe we should change the subject. Um, Amy, how are your lady parts? Still chilly down there?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Hang on. None of Sheldon’s theories have ever been definitively proven. My husband actually went to outer space.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s an impressive accomplishment. He’s now an inspiration to millions of Americans who know you don’t have to be special or even qualified to go into space.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I remember the first time I got a bikini wax. My sister did it with melted Crayolas and duct tape. It’s a bad idea.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Gosh, Amy. I’m sensing a little hostility. Is it maybe because, like Sheldon’s work, your sex life is also theoretical?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Damn.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yeah, well, at least when we do make love, Sheldon won’t be thinking about his mother. And yes, that is a cleverly veiled reference to Howard’s lifelong obsession to crawl back into her spacious womb.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Anyway, to this day, I still can’t see a box of crayons without crossing my legs.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t have to take this. I’m gonna go home and have sex with my husband right now. Maybe I’ll let him do it to me in the parking spot. Which sounds dirty, but I didn’t mean it that way,

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, here’s another one: If a zombie bites a vampire, and the vampire bites a human, does the human become a vampire or a zombie? Or a zompire?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Cookie.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t have any.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m not giving it away.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s in my spot. Leonard, make him stop being naked in my spot.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Howard, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He wasn’t using it. And I needed a nice cool piece of leather to wiggle my naked ass on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Get off there.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Give me back my Iron Man helmet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Give me back my parking space.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You don’t need a parking space. You don’t have a car.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You don’t need an Iron Man helmet. You’re not Iron Man.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, we appear to have reached an impasse. And you know, I have to say, I thought you’d be more upset that your laptop is sitting on my junk.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I didn’t pick up on that. That’s a nice touch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: This is so exciting. I’m feeling all tingly. Although that could just be my newly defoliated bikini zone.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Keep a lookout. This place is swarming with campus security. They will not hesitate to scold us.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Freaking pigs.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Okay, now, pull your car into the spot and let’s get out of here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wait, I’m leaving my car here?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, and be sure and put on the emergency brake. Really makes these things tough to budge.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Before I park, come in the back seat. I want to show you something I had done today.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, colour me intrigued.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think you’re high on paint fumes. And boy, that’s a lot of Band-Aids.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, Howard’s mother is in, like, every one of your wedding photos.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What can I tell ya? She’s a big girl. Wherever you look, there she is. More coffee?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, Leonard’s taking me to a physics lecture, and coffee’ll just keep me awake. Oh, I’ll get it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, looks like someone’s on Team Bernadette. Where’s Howard?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s not here. What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: He had my car towed. It cost me two hundred dollars to get it back.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, no. Where was it parked?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: In Sheldon’s spot.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That doesn’t make sense. Sheldon doesn’t have a spot. Was it maybe in Howard’s spot?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Don’t play dumb with me, sister. You tell your husband he owes me two hundred dollars.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, that doesn’t make sense, either.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Because I’m the one who had it towed.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Didn’t see that one coming, did ya?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, yeah? Well, you’re not gonna see this coming.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ow! Ow!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, my God,

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Are you okay?!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You idiot, what the hell do you have in there?!

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Just my wallet, keys and a coffee can full of change I’ve been meaning to take to the bank.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Don’t move. I’ll get some ice.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Get away from me or I swear to God I will rip out what’s left of your pubes!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thanks. Ah!

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Amy, you think maybe this has gotten a little out of hand?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Gee, you think?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I do. Penny, Bernadette and I are sorry.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You hit her! What did I do?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You had my car towed.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You were parked in Howard’s spot.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I was parked in Sheldon’s spot.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Sheldon doesn’t have a spot.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Guys, I think I need to go to the emergency room.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’ll drive. You can see where the tow truck scratched my car.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: The tow truck didn’t scratch your car.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: ‘Cause I did it!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Morning, Professor Stevens. Don’t look at that whiteboard. That’s my math, not your math. Keep walking, nosey.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. You said I’m not using my space, so I’m using it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, you need to move now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I don’t.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You can’t stay there forever.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Actually, I have a plastic baggy strapped to my leg that says I can. Give up, Wolowitz. You’ve chosen to tangle with a superior intellect you can’t defeat. There is nothing you could possibly do to…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Those aren’t gonna help you, Sheldon,

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, yes, they are. I mean, what?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m warning you, Sheldon!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Your threats are empty, nothing can move me. Stop that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Get out of my spot.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. That’s it. I am calling campus security. You prepare for the scolding of your life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What are you idiots doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: He’s trying to kill me, Leonard. Video games and rock music have desensitized him to violence.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Would you please talk some sense into your lunatic roommate?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’re both acting like lunatics. It’s just a parking spot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s not just a parking spot. He can’t handle the fact that I’m a bigger deal than he is now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, preposterous. I have been solely responsible for this university’s six loop quantum gravity calculations, I have changed the way we think about Bose-Einstein condensates, and I am also the one who got Nutter Butters in the cafeteria vending machine. Maybe you missed that news while you were floating around like a goof in outer space. Now, if you’ll excuse me, I have work to do.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Can you believe this guy?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What I don’t believe is that you tried to run him over.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, like you’ve never thought of doing that. Don’t hate me just because I lived the dream.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, sweet ride.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are you doing in there?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Just breaking in your new car.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stop that. You stop that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know what they say? Revenge is a dish best served nude.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, got a minute?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, of course, come in. This is an authentic Chinese throwing star, and I must warn you, I have seen many people throw them in movies.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Calm down. Howard has something he wants to say to you.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right. Sheldon, when this whole thing with the parking space started, I had no idea just how much of a crazy bastard…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Howard, that’s not how we practiced it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I had no idea how much that spot meant to you. Anyway, I called President Siebert and told him it’s not worth fighting over the spot, so you keep it, and I’ll park in the structure across the street.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, Howard, thank you. It’s quite a gesture on your part. You’ve shown yourself to be the bigger man.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Which I find totally unacceptable. I must be the bigger man. Therefore, you may use my spot until such time as I learn to drive or get a Batmobile.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow, okay. Well, thanks. I don’t know what to say.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: There is nothing to say. Except I’m the bigger man. I’m not kidding. Say it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Just say it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You’re the bigger man, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, stop. And I believe this is yours. FYI, if you wear that into a bank, they will tackle you to the ground.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’d like to propose a toast, to burying the hatchet.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: To burying the hatchet.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, I’m kind of glad this happened.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Me, too. In some weird way, I kind of feel like it brought us closer.

utterance.speaker: Penny (with two black eyes and a plaster across her nose)
utterance.content: Yeah, everybody’s happy, great.

utterance.speaker: Shopkeeper
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. According to information I gleaned from Yelp, you had great success when a santeriasuzy37 brought you a pair of leather slacks stained with chicken blood. I believe I may have a similar problem. This cushion experienced a nude revenge wiggle.

utterance.speaker: Shopkeeper
utterance.content: A what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: A naked man sat on it. Now, here’s my concern, his diet is rich in fatty deli meats. What test do you have to detect lipid residue?

utterance.speaker: Shopkeeper
utterance.content: Lipid what?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Lipid residue. An anal autograph. A colon calling card, if you will.

utterance.speaker: Shopkeeper
utterance.content: Tuesday okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t rush it. We may be dealing with befoulment on a molecular level.

utterance.speaker: Shopkeeper
utterance.content: Let me write you a ticket.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Is that your son?

utterance.speaker: Shopkeeper
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Looks like that laptop’s seen better days. If you’re interested, I’m selling this. It’s only two years old, 16 gigabytes of RAM, Intel core i7 processor, and I can personally guarantee it has spent less than 20 minutes resting on an astronaut’s penis.
